title:
Variational Analysis of Proximal Compositions and Integral Proximal
  Mixtures
authors: Patrick L. Combettes and Diego J. Cornejo
abstract:
This paper establishes various variational properties of parametrized
versions of two convexity-preserving constructs that were recently introduced
in the literature: the proximal composition of a function and a linear
operator, and the integral proximal mixture of arbitrary families of functions
and linear operators. We study in particular convexity, Legendre conjugacy,
differentiability, Moreau envelopes, coercivity, minimizers, recession
functions, and perspective functions of these constructs, as well as their
asymptotic behavior as the parameter varies. The special case of the proximal
expectation of a family of functions is also discussed.
